title: 113_hr5289
content:
The Act titled "Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Act of 2014" establishes the Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Grant Program. The Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Grant Program is established by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to assist projects for the protection and restoration of the Indian River Lagoon in Florida. Grants may be awarded on a competitive basis to State and local government entities, nonprofit organizations, and the Indian River Lagoon Program. Entities must submit an application with project details to be eligible for a grant. The Administrator will issue regulations for selecting projects for grants under the Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Grant Program. Criteria will prioritize projects that reduce nutrient loads, benefit the Indian River Lagoon, and align with the comprehensive plan. Consultation with the Indian River Lagoon Program, the State of Florida, and local governments in the watershed will be conducted during project selection. The Federal share of the cost for projects assisted with a grant under the Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Grant Program is typically 75 percent, but recipients can request a lower share. Definitions in this section include the term "comprehensive plan" as approved under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act for the Indian River Lagoon. The Indian River Lagoon Program, established under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act, includes various committees and is funded through the Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Trust Fund. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the Program each fiscal year. The Administrator of the Indian River Lagoon Program is limited to using 5 percent of the funds for administrative expenses. No funds can be used for management conference expenses under a specific section of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. The eligibility of the Program to receive funding under a certain section of the Act is not limited by this rule. SEC. 3. INCREASE IN CIVIL PENALTIES: The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency must raise civil penalty amounts by 5% for violations of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. These regulations only apply to violations occurring after the enactment of this Act. 

SEC. 4. INDIAN RIVER LAGOON NUTRIENT REMOVAL ASSISTANCE TRUST FUND: A new section is added to the Internal Revenue Code establishing the Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Trust Fund. The Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Trust Fund is created in the Treasury of the United States to receive appropriations and penalties for violations of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. The fund is used to make grants under the Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Grant Program. The Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Grant Program was established under the Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Act of 2014. A clerical amendment was made to the table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 98 of the Code. The Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Trust Fund was established under the Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Act of 2014.
